page.title: 05A typical Brereton Farm.
page.content: My name is John Davenport and I farm in partnership with my wife Jenny,at Lightfoot Green Farm,Brereton 78856387 We started farming on our own in April 1971 and at the present time we farm 180 acres.Three different{crops}are grown,Potatoes,(16acres)Wheat and Barley(34acres)and grass(130acres);77 acres of grass is cut twice yearly for silage.The rest of the grassland is grazed by cows and sheep.Our{livestock comprises of 100 Freisian dairy cows, plus one Hereford bull,120 Scotch half bred ewes and 3 rams,(one Dorset Down,and 2 Suffolks).We fattened 125 turkeys for sale at Christmas. We organise the ewes so that they begin lambing from the beginning of January to the end of March hoping to get the lambs ready for the Easter market.
